newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary inflation may go down to 10 pct by end-1998.
newsitem.headline: Hungary inflation may go down to 10 pct by end-1998.

text.p: Hungary's inflation may be cut to some 10 percent year-on-year by December 1998 from some 20 percent last December, central bank Chairman Gyorgy Suranyi said on Wednesday.
"In our heads this ambitious 1998 target is somewhere around 10 percent on a December to December basis," Suranyi told the parliament's economic committee.
Suranyi said Hungary was likely to reduce year-on-year inflation to 17 percent by December 1997.
He added that the condition of an even more drastic cut in 1998 was a wide-ranging social and economic agreement.
"For that (1998 inflation cut) certainly very wide cooperation is necessary and a framework of agreements between interest groups," Suranyi said.
